body:
I view this as a bug in Scaleway's S3 implementation!

There is no way (as far as I know) to query the maximum number of chunks for a multipart upload, but rclone needs to know it in order to raise the chunk size when the maximum number of chunks would be exceeded.

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/c4572ebc91288957356de519a178e9dd21da09e3/backend/s3/s3.go#L2187-L2191

Currently this is a constant in rclone's code

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/c4572ebc91288957356de519a178e9dd21da09e3/backend/s3/s3.go#L899

This could be made a config parameter.

Perhaps better would be to make a provider for "Scaleway" and provide that workaround for the Scaleway provider is detected.

A work-around might be to raise the `--s3-chunk-size`. Note that 5MB is AWS's recommended size and that raising it uses more memory.

@hex2a do you want to work on this?

I had the same problem and I used @ncw workaround: I set `--s3-chunk-size` at 20M and it works fine.
It uses more ressources but my server can handle it (for now).
Problem is you have to know what size is your biggest file to adjust in consequence.
@notarobot63 I suggested better / more intelligent defaults in #4255

The best solution to this IMHO would be for scaleway to bring their service into s3 compliance and allow 10,000 chunks per file.

Maybe one of you could write to their support and ask them about that? I'm not a scaleway customer alas...

I'd suggest something like

---- 

In your s3 multipart upload docs you state that the maximum number of parts allowed per file is 1,000

https://www.scaleway.com/en/docs/s3-multipart-upload/

However the defacto-standard provided by AWS allows 10,000 parts

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/API/API_UploadPart.html

Your service only allowing 1,000 makes it slightly incompatible with S3 and breaks various tools includind rclone - see

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/4159

Would you consider increasing this number to 10,000?

Thanks to @ayufan this a fix for this is now merged.

You can use the `max_upload_parts = 1000` parameter in the config file.

I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) in 15-30 mins and released in v1.53
Thanks a lot @ayufan and @ncw for your help and reactivity !

I'm not sure this is the right place to post since the issue is closed, but my suggestion is very much related : I think the [s3 config sample](https://rclone.org/s3/#scaleway) should include the magic `max_upload_parts = 1000` line. And maybe a comment about it with a link to [Scaleway's doc](https://www.scaleway.com/en/docs/s3-multipart-upload/#-Object-Storage--Multipart-Upload) ?

For information, [following your suggestion](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/4159#issuecomment-633472277) I opened a ticket on Scaleway, here's the response : 

> We don't have any plan about it, we're sorry.
> The main goal is to protect the stability of our services. 

So I guess `max_upload_parts` is going to be here for a while.

> For information, [following your suggestion](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/4159#issuecomment-633472277) I opened a ticket on Scaleway, here's the response :
> 
> > We don't have any plan about it, we're sorry.
> > The main goal is to protect the stability of our services.
> 
> So I guess `max_upload_parts` is going to be here for a while.

Thanks for asking!

What we should really do is make a provider for Scaleway (then we can list the endpoints etc) and have a little bit of code which resets max_upload_parts to 1000 for the Scaleway provider.

It is relatively easy adding a provider - do you fancy having a go at that @psychopatt  or someone else on this thread? It is a question of editing the data structures here, then putting a 3 line patch in to reset the MaxUploadParts...

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/d55053098f98a5c6200ad2c75a05a142be96b3d8/backend/s3/s3.go#L75

I personally have a problem running anything using Scaleway S3. I try for a few days to upload 250GB file using Multipart upload adhering to their limits of 1000 parts. It fails consistently with 500's :)

@ayufan Thanks to your patch I had no problem uploading a 180GB one yesterday, so far no other problems with Scaleway !
@ncw I'm new to GitHub, pull requests and everything but I can give it a try. I'm just not sure about the "3 line patch in to reset the MaxUploadParts" so I might ask for details if it doesn't become clear reading the code.
